calendar

Class Month

  • java.lang.Object
    • calendar.Month

  • public class Month
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores information of a single month, it contains some functionality for retrieval of this information in a way that is relevant to a calendar program. Such as storing days in a 2d array. Assumptions/Restrictions: None. Noteworthy Features: Month names are returned fitted in the middle if retrieved from the getFittedName method. I added full month names so the user has the option to use them if desired.
    Author:
    Andrew Rau-Chaplin, some additions by Ryan Amaral

      Creates a month object from a specific month in a specific year.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Month

        public Month(int year,
             int monthNum)
        Creates a month object from a specific month in a specific year. It uses the GregorianCalendar class to get information about the specific month. It takes into account leap years and also stores all of the days in the month in a 2d array in the format [year] [day of week].
        Parameters:
        year - -> The year that the month is from.
        monthNum - -> The number month of the year.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Returns the short 3-letter name of the month.

      • getNameLong

        public java.lang.String getNameLong()
        Returns:
        Returns the full name of the month.

      • getFittedName

        public java.lang.String getFittedName(java.lang.Boolean isLongVersion)
        Takes the selected month name and returns it fitted to the middle of 20 chars.
        Parameters:
        isLongVersion - -> If true, returns the long version of the month name
        Returns:
        Returns the month name formatted to fit in the middle of 20 chars.

      • weekString

        public java.lang.String weekString(int week)
        Returns a string representing the days in the chosen week. each of the days in the week is 3 characters long, even if it is not a day in the month so that things are evenly spaced.
        Parameters:
        week - -> The week in the month
        Returns:
        Returns a string representing the days in the chosen week.
